annotations::​sized
interface
annotations::​ .​sized

An annotation for container types.

Implementations must define the size() method.

methods
size
pure virtual function int size()

Returns the current size of the container.

Implementations shoud return an integer value greater or equal to 0, where 0 is returned for an empty container.

annotations::​hashable
interface
annotations::​ .​hashable

An annotation for associative container types.

Implementations must define the hash() method.

methods
hash
pure virtual function int hash()

Returns an integer hash value.

The only required property is that object which compare equal have the same hash value.

annotations::​container
interface
annotations::​ .​container

An annotation for container types.

Implementations must define the contains() method.

methods
contains
pure virtual function bit contains(
T 
item
)

Return 1 if item is in the container, or 0 otherwise.

annotations::​sequential
interface
annotations::​ .​sequential

An annotation for sequential container types.

A sequential container is an iterable which supports efficient element access using integer indices via the get() method.

methods
get
pure virtual function T get(
int 
index
)

Returns the item at the specified index.

Invalid indices are handled gracefully by returning a default value.

An implementation may also optionally issue a warning on an access attempt to an invalid index.
